title: #11 of June 2018 Grade 12 - Natural Sciences CSAT (Korean SAT) Mock test
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\int_1^{\sqrt{2}} x^3\sqrt{x^2-1}dx."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is expected that you solve this in 2 minutes. (without calculator of course)"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is a part of <Grade 12 CSAT Mock test> series.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

title: Let 11 divide!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \text{N}= {\color{#3D99F6}100a + 10b + c }\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" I have a  three digits number as shown above which is always divisible by 11 where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a, b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are it's digits. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"blockquote","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} & (1) \phantom{c}a \leq b ,  \phantom{c}a-b +c =0 \\& (2) \phantom{c}  a >b, \phantom{c} a+b +c =11 \\& (3) \phantom{c}  a > c ,\phantom{c}  a-c -b =0 \\& (4) \phantom{c} c> a, \phantom{c}  c-a-b = 0\\&\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many of the above statements are/is always true ?"}]}]}

title: 11's remainders

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} S_1 & = \sum_{n=6}^{10} (2n+1)^{n-5} \\ & = \sum_{n=1}^5 (2n+11)^n \\ \implies S_1 & \equiv \sum_{n=1}^5 (2n)^n \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv (2^1+4^2+6^3+8^4+10^5) \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv (2+5+(-5)^3+(-3)^4+(-1)^5) \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv (2+5-4+4-1) \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv 6 \pmod {11} \end{aligned}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} S_2 & = \sum_{n=6}^{10} (2n)^{n-5} \\ & = \sum_{n=1}^5 (2n+10)^n \\ \implies S_2 & \equiv \sum_{n=1}^5 (2n-1)^n \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv (1^1+3^2+5^3+7^4+9^5) \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv (1+9+4+(-4)^4+(-2)^5) \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv (1+9+4+3-10) \pmod {11} \\ & \equiv 7 \pmod {11} \end{aligned}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, we have:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} a^4b^4 & \equiv 6^47^4 \pmod{11} \\ & \equiv 42^4 \pmod{11} \\ & \equiv (-2)^4 \pmod{11} \\ & \equiv \boxed{5} \pmod{11} \end{aligned}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
